snippet: The Mobil Corporation said today that it had an agreement with the Shell Oil Company, a unit of Royal/Dutch Shell, to form a new company with the California oil-producing operations of both companies. The new company would have proven reserves of ...
lead_paragraph: The Mobil Corporation said today that it had an agreement with the Shell Oil Company, a unit of Royal/Dutch Shell, to form a new company with the California oil-producing operations of both companies. The new company would have proven reserves of more than 1 billion barrels of oil and production of approximately 250,000 barrels a day, Mobil said. Mobil, based in Fairfax, Va., said it would own a 40 percent equity interest and Calresources would own the rest. The new company, expected to start operating by mid-1997, would be based in Bakersfield, Calif., where Mobil now employs 500 people and Calresources has 875.
abstract: Mobil Corp says it has agreed with Shell Oil Co, unit of Royal Dutch/Shell, to form new company with California oil-producing operations of both companies; says new company would have proven reserves of more than 1 billion barrels of oil and production of about 250,000 barrels a day (S)

headline.main: MOBIL AND SHELL OIL TO MERGE CALIF. OPERATIONS
